page.title: 17NATURE IN THE BUNGAY AREA
page.content: NATURE IN THE BUNGAY AREA A BIRD SURVEY SHOWED A GOOD YEARS BREED ING.SPARROWS WERE THE MOST COMMON, FOLLOWED BY STARLINGS,HOUSE MARTINS, SWIFTS,SWALLOWS,CROWS,BLACKBIRDS,WOOD PIGEONS,BLUE TIT,AND PARTRIDGES.THRUSH- ES,KINGFISHER,TREE CREEPERS AND GREBES WERE NOT SO NUMEROUS.SQUIRRELS AND RAB- BITS WERE ALSO SEEN.IF YOU WENT OUT LAST YEAR YOU WOULD HAVE GOT WET ON 72 DAYS, CAUGHT IN A SHOWER ON 29 DAYS, SHELTERED FROM 11 STORMS,BLOWN AWAY ON 29 WINDY DAYS,LOST IN 11 FOGGY DAYS,SAW IT SNOW ON 8 DAYS AND SAW THE SUN ON 208 DAYS.THE NATIONALLY FAMOUS OTTER TRUST IS IN EARSHAM, NEAR BUNGAY. HERE THERE ARE OTTERS,GEESE,DUCKS AND DEER.THE OTTERS ARE BRED IN CAPTIVITY AND MANY ARE RELEASED INTO THE WILD.
